benchmark_details.name: CodeCriticBench
benchmark_details.overview: CodeCriticBench is a holistic benchmark for evaluating the code critique capabilities of Large Language Models (LLMs) on two core tasks: code generation and code-based question answering, each incorporating multiple levels of difficulty and advanced evaluation metrics.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the critique abilities of LLMs on the code domain, providing a comprehensive analysis of their performance in code generation and code QA tasks.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The evaluation is confined to single-file scenarios and currently focuses only on code.

data.source: Collected from various coding datasets including CodeForces, MBPP, and LiveCodeBench, with modifications for error generation and real-world applicability.
data.annotation: Manually annotated by experts and through majority voting for correctness.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on predictions matching true labels for the accuracy and measuring the discrepancy for MSE.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy and lower MSE scores indicate better performance in model evaluations.
methodology.validation: Evaluated against a variety of LLMs using predefined benchmarks.

harm: Data integrity issues due to the potential for unannounced ethical biases in the benchmarks.
